He asked him to accompany Paul. He permitted him, and he joined with him, and served Paul the Apostle in the pure missionary [work] with an alert mind. He preached in the name of Christ and restored many of the Jews and the pagans to the knowledge of truth, and baptized them in the name of the Holy Trinity. He destroyed the temples of idols and built them as houses for Christ. He endured shackles and iron chains from the unbelievers, and all kinds of punishments. They threw him into the fire, and tossed him to the hungry dangerous lions, but they did not touch his body with any evil, for the angel of the Lord was always with him until he completed his struggle.

He distributed his money to the poor and the weak, and there was nothing left of the luxuries of this world except an iron crutch. He walked and roamed seeking the bodies. When they led him to them, he sat weeping over them for a long time. He then rose up hurriedly and went to the governor, and confessed [the faith] in Christ with great openness. He ordered they place a heavy long pillar on his abdomen. At that hour he completed his struggle. The governor ordered his body be burnt, along with the body of his mother and brother and many other bodies. With the power of Christ acting through these martyrs, the fire burned neither them nor the clothes they had on.

He saw in a dream one night someone saying to him, â€˜Save your soul.â€™ As the teachings of our Lord Jesus Christ spread over the entire world, his uncle sent him to see if all the miracles were true. When Titus came and saw the Lord Jesus and all His many astounding miracles, he believed in Him. The Lord chose him as one of the seventy disciples, and filled him with the Holy Spirit. And when the Lord chose him, he accompanied Paul to all the cities and places Paul went to. When the martyrdom of Paul was completed, he returned to his town Crete and built a great church there. And when he completed his holy struggle, he reposed and departed to Christ.

After the Ascension of our good Savior, he accompanied our father Paul traveling in his pure missionary (work). He was filled with the Holy Spirit, the Paraclete, in Zionâ€™s upper room with the disciples of Christ. He accompanied Paul in the travails he endured, and carried his epistles to the cities and countries, and taught many of the Jews and Gentiles; he restored them to the orthodox faith, and baptized them all. When Paul completed his struggle in the city of Rome, he returned to Crete his city, and built in it a church, and ordained in it priests and deacons also. There he performed many miracles and wonders. Then he reposed in good old age and rejoiced with Christ in the heavenly Jerusalem.

For in truth, you are the third in the angelic hosts. Raphael the powerful, your name is in the heavens, and you are called healer of hearts. For in truth, it is you who appeared to Theodosius, the god-loving king, and spoke with him in the city of Alexan`dria with regards to our saintly father Abba Theophilus, for he was angry with him because he chastised him concerning his sister Pulcheria. The righteous one was indeed placed in a wooden sarcophagus on the orders of the prince and they hid him in the ground. Raphael the archangel, the powerful, petitioned the Lord for him that he might not die. The meaning of your name is in the mouths of the faithful, they are saying: "O God of Raphael, help us."

O pure archangel, when she saw him she glorified the God of heaven in your church.

as the prophet said: "Be certain and know that IÂ am the God." We ask you, our blessed father, the great Abba Poemen to remember us before our Savior, our Lord Jesus Christ, to perfect us in the work of monasticism. Hail to Abba Poemen, successor of the layer of the law, the great Abba Antony. Hail to the visionary one (who is) like Samuel. Hail to the recruiter of monks. Hail to the meek one, like unto David. Hail to the fighter of the western tribes. Hail to the persecutor of evil spirits, (who is) like John, the beloved of Christ. Hail to the one who completed his seeking well, and celebrated with Christ in His kingdom.

You became a hero on earth, and with your great, exalted humility you healed the sick, exorcised demons, and became a harbor for many souls until you gathered them into the heavenly Jerusalem. You became for us a refuge and a cause for the salvation of our souls because of your pure name after which we were called, for you plead before the Lord for us night and day so that the devil might be vanquished under our feet. You rose so high, much higher than many of our fathers, because of your great asceticism and great worship. Your fruit multiplied much more than the rice of Lebanon, and spread upon the mountains like the grass of the earth. All the ranks of monks were blessed by you, for it is you who strengthened them as soldiers of Christ.

He consoled all who came to him from every place with perfect love, long patience, and deliberateness. Truly blessed are you, our father the saint, Abba Parsouma, for you fulfilled the sayings of our Savior. He said: "He who loves me, let him renounce himself, carry his cross, and follow me." Blessed are you indeed, for you renounced yourself, carried your cross, and followed Christ. Blessed are you indeed, our father, the saint Abba Parsouma, for you became perfect in the doing the commandments of the Lord. Blessed are you indeed, our father, the saint Abba Parsouma, for you deserved this great glory in your honorable commemoration, and the sayings of our Savior in his pure gospel, was fulfilled in you, as He thus said: "A city on a mountain cannot be hidden, and a lit lantern cannot be placed in hiding, but atop a tower for its light to be seen." Similarly, the righteous, Abba Parsouma, became an illuminated lantern. Therefore, we ask you our faithful father, to supplicate for us before our Lord, Jesus Christ, so that we might receive mercy and the forgiveness of sins, and be perfect as Christians to the last breath.
